title: Remove user registration validation from Send BTC flow

requirements.text: Remove all backend code in the sendBTC method (backend/main.mo) that validates whether the destination Bitcoin address corresponds to a registered user account or user profile, so that any Bitcoin mainnet address can be used as a transfer destination without triggering a 'user not registered' error.
acceptanceCriteria: The backend sendBTC method accepts any destination address text without checking user registration status
No 'user not registered' or 'account not found' errors are generated based on destination address lookup
The destination address is passed directly to the blockchain broadcast API without intermediate user profile validation
Existing balance checks and access control (caller authentication) remain enforced
The change does not affect credit purchase, withdrawal, or other account-based flows

requirements.text: Update any backend error handling or validation logic in the sendBTC flow to ensure that address format validation (if any remains) only checks Bitcoin mainnet address syntax via the blockchain API, not app user registry existence.
acceptanceCriteria: Address validation errors (if any) come from the blockchain API response, not from app user registry checks
Clear English error messages are returned when the blockchain API rejects an address as invalid
No error messages reference user account registration requirements for recipients

constraints: Do not remove caller authentication or balance verification checks
Preserve the existing transfer request creation and ledger accounting logic
Keep the blockchain API broadcast integration intact
Maintain audit trail for all transfer attempts
nonGoals: Modifying the frontend Send BTC form validation
Altering the transfer request data model
